agency_desc: County veterans service officers are veterans employed by the county to act as liaisons with county residents for veteran issues, including but not limited to; providing forms, information, and assistance in obtaining state and federal veterans benefits.
service_description: Provides information about and assistance with veterans' benefits to veterans, their surviving spouses, and their children. County service officers can assist in the completion and submission of forms necessary to receive all appropriate federal and state veterans' benefits.
site_details: Call to make an appointment.
site_eligibility: Veteran, surviving spouses or children of a veteran

agency_desc: A government agency that provides household recycling and hazardous waste collection and education and information about recycling, reusing, and reducing environmental hazards.
service_description: Maintains drop-off sites around Newton County for collecting recyclables including: flattened corrugated cardboard and  box board, glass, plastics (1-5, 7), aluminum, tin, and steel beverage and food cans, newspapers, and magazines. Call for information on recycling in nearby towns.
site_details: Walk in, email, call, or visit the website for information.

site_schedule.name: Recycling Centers
site_schedule.schedule: Mon-Fri 7:30am-3:30pm -- Drop Off: Varies by site

site_schedule.name: Specialized Information and Referral
site_schedule.schedule: Mon-Fri 7:30am-3:30pm -- Drop Off: Varies by site

site_eligibility: Residential households in the county

agency_desc: A church with worship services and charitable outreach, including a soup kitchen.
service_description: Provides a free, hot dinner each week to persons in need.
site_details: Dine in: Walk in -- Carry-out: Walk in and fill a to-go box. -- Pre-order pick up: Pre-order your meals by 4pm and drive-thru pick up starting at 5pm.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: A public library that provides access to fiction and non-fiction library materials to patrons of all ages.
service_description: Offers delivery of requested library materials to homebound persons in the town of Brook and of Washington township in Newton County.
site_details: Call to request delivery or visit the website.

site_schedule.schedule: Mon, Tues, Wed and Fri 9am-7pm; Sat 9am-1pm

site_schedule.schedule: Mon, Tues, Wed and Fri 9am-7pm; Sat 9am-1pm

site_schedule.schedule: Mon, Tues, Wed and Fri 9am-7pm; Sat 9am-1pm

agency_desc: A church offering worship services and charitable outreach, including a food pantry. Clothing may sometimes be available.
service_name: FAITH HARVEST FOOD AND CLOTHING PANTRY
service_description: Provides perishable and nonperishable food and gently used clothing to those in need. Clients make their own selections. Food pantry deliveries made to homebound clients once a month. Sizes and types of clothing available depends on donations. Limited service area.
site_details: Walk in. -- Be prepared to complete contact information and income form. -- May send a proxy for family member or caregiver to pick up food but requires a completed proxy form every six months. -- Homebound clients may request a monthly delivery.
site_eligibility: Living in Newton County -- Limit one visit per month

agency_desc: Coordinates emergency management programs and response measures in Newton County.
service_description: Offers weather alert radios to persons in need in Newton County, while supplies last. Weather alert radios provide information for emergencies including hazardous weather, local area warnings, and current weather conditions from the National Weather Service.
site_details: Call for availability or to make a request.

site_schedule.name: County Offices of Emergency Services
site_schedule.schedule: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm; on call for emergencies daily 24 hours

site_schedule.name: Disaster Relief/Recovery Organizations
site_schedule.schedule: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm; on call for emergencies daily 24 hours

site_schedule.schedule: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm; on call for emergencies daily 24 hours

site_schedule.schedule: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm; on call for emergencies daily 24 hours

site_schedule.schedule: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm; on call for emergencies daily 24 hours

site_eligibility: Homeowners -- Mobile home occupants -- Low income

service_description: Provides nonperishable food to people in need. Limited service area.
site_details: Walk in.
site_eligibility: With financial need based on income guidelines -- DURING COVID-19 CRISIS: Open

agency_desc: Provides access to fiction and non-fiction library materials to patrons of all ages.
service_description: Maintains a public lending library for residents of the city of Goodland and Grant Township of Newton County. Circulates books, eBooks, periodicals, audio books, CDs, and DVDs. Provides phone-based reference assistance. In-house services include public computer and Internet access.
site_details: Walk in to apply for a library card, check out materials, or use in-house services. Call for information.

site_schedule.schedule: Mon, Tues, Wed, and Fri noon-5pm; Thurs noon-8pm; Sat 9am-1pm

agency_desc: An elected official responsible for administering the township, including such duties as providing township assistance, burial of the indigent, and maintaining the township budget.
service_description: May be able to assist township residents who are experiencing an unexpected crisis with basic needs, such as:  Essential utilities -- Burial/Cremation expenses -- Housing expense -- Work/Medical transportation -- Food/Clothing -- Necessary medications/medical care assistance is at the discretion of the trustee. Denials can be appealed to the county commissioner; information on appealing is included in the denial letter.

nameLevel4: Prescription Drugs for Specific Health Conditions

service_description: Provides primary and preventative health care services to those in need regardless of ability to pay.

site_eligibility: Living in Newton County -- Limit one visit per calendar month

agency_desc: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools within the district.
service_description: Administers the elementary, middle, and high schools in this school district. District provides information regarding special education services for students age 3-22 with disabilities.
site_details: Call for information about school assignments, transportation, or other issues. -- Contact the assigned school to enroll.
site_eligibility: Students living within the school district in grades K-12

agency_desc: Provides electric service to customers within the service area.
service_description: Provides electric service to customers in Newton County and portions of Benton and Jasper counties.

site_schedule.name: Electric Service Providers
site_schedule.schedule: Office: Mon-Fri 7am-4pm -- Outage Reporting: Daily 24 hours

site_eligibility: Open; serves addresses within set boundaries in Benton, Jasper, and Newton County.

agency_desc: Government agency that locates, identifies, and appraises all taxable property in Newton County.
service_description: Calculates the value of all taxable property in Newton County, which is then used to assess taxes. Hears appeals of assessments, oversees reassessments, and maintains information on property description and ownership.
site_details: Call or visit the website for more information.
site_eligibility: Varies by service; limited to taxable property in Newton County

agency_desc: A government agency that provides public health nursing, works to control the spread of communicable disease, investigates environmental hazards, and maintains vital records for the county.
service_description: Works to prevent or control the spread of communicable diseases in the County. Investigates reports of communicable diseases, provides community education programs, and offers public health nursing services.
site_details: Communicable disease investigations are generally referred through hospitals and clinics; call for additional information.
site_eligibility: Varies by service; call for information.

Living within the county -- Testing is recommended for any child 6 months through 6 years old who: Lives in or visits a building constructed before 1978 -Or- lives with someone who works with lead (such as a battery factory, steel smelter, stained glass) -OR- has a sibling or playmate who has been diagnosed with lead poisoning.
Varies by service; serves Newton County
Age 6 months or older

Living within the County -- Age 2 months through 18 years -- Without health insurance -OR- insurance does not cover needed vaccine (including coverage that has capped out) -OR- insured through Medicaid -OR- American Indian or Alaskan Native, regardless of insurance status
Births/deaths occurring in the County -- Individual named on the birth certificate, parent, or other adult with a legal right to the certificate
Schools, community organizations, and other groups in the County
Living within the county

agency_desc: Represents the state of Indiana in felony and misdemeanor criminal prosecutions, conducts criminal investigations, supervises Grand Jury proceedings, enforces child support orders, conducts juvenile adjudication and prosecution, enforces traffic violations, and provides information and assistance to victims of crime.
service_description: Files, modifies, and enforces court-ordered child support cases in Newton County.
site_details: To apply for child support or request child support enforcement or modification,  call the prosecutor's office to schedule an appointment. For payment information, call the Indiana Kids Line.
site_eligibility: To File for Child Support Assistance -- Living in Newton County -- Parent, guardian, aunt, uncle, or grandparent who has physical custody of a child (ages 0-18) -- Requiring financial support from a noncustodial parent of the child
Open
Victims and witnesses of major crimes in Newton County

agency_desc: Serves as the state trial court for the county, hearing both civil and criminal cases.
service_description: Handles civil lawsuits for $6,000 or less, including contracts, collection of rent, evictions, and personal loans. Only corporations are required to be represented by an attorney and only on claims over $1,500. In Newton County, Circuit Court handles small claims cases.
site_eligibility: Open
Persons named in cases or called for jury duty at this court
Offenders assigned to probation by the Newton County Courts

agency_desc: Enforces animal-related ordinances, responds to animal-related emergencies, impounds stray domestic animals, and accepts surrendered animals from the public within the county.
service_description: Enforces animal-related ordinances, responds to animal-related emergencies, impounds stray domestic animals, and accepts surrendered animals from the public. Provides lost-and-found services and adoption for homeless dogs and cats.
site_details: Call for more information.
site_eligibility: Open

agency_desc: The County Clerk maintains records of all civil and criminal court activities; administers jury draw, child support collections, and voter registration; issues marriage licenses; and records state tax liens.
service_description: Maintains records of all county-level court cases, and issues marriage licenses. Files petitions for divorce, probate, adoption, name change, child custody, parental visitation, record expungement, and protective orders. Processes payments for child support, foreclosures, court costs, and other judgments. Oversees elections in the county.
taxonomy_name: Criminal Record Expungement Petition Filing Offices
nameLevel4: Criminal Record Expungement Petition Filing Offices
site_details: Call or walk in for information.

site_schedule.name: Criminal Record Expungement Petition Filing Offices
Child Support Assistance/Enforcement
site_schedule.schedule: Clerk's Office: Mon-Fri 8am-4pm -- Indiana Kids Line (Payment Information): Recorded information daily 24 hours; live assistance Mon-Fri 7am-6pm

Parents ordered by the court to pay or receive child support
Registering to vote: United States citizen -- Age 18 by the day of the next election -- Not currently incarcerated -- To vote: Registered to vote a minimum of 29 days before the election

Marriage license: Both parties at least age 18 (call or visit website for exceptions) -- At least one applicant from this county -OR- both from out of state -- Certified copies: License must have been issued in this county

agency_desc: Provides law enforcement, crime investigation, crime prevention, emergency assistance, and other police duties for the town of Goodland.
service_description: Provides law enforcement, crime investigation, crime prevention, emergency assistance, and other police duties for the town of Goodland in Newton County. Persons in need of emergency police assistance should call 9-1-1.
site_details: Call 9-1-1 for emergency assistance. For nonemergency services, call the office during business hours or call Newton County dispatch after hours.
site_eligibility: Open; serves the town of Goodland

agency_desc: Serves as the executive and administrative authority.
service_description: Serves as the executive and administrative authority for Newton County, including performing the following duties: controls, maintains, and supervises county property; audits and authorizes claims against the county; receives bids for and authorizes county contracts; performs certain election functions; handles appeal of township trustee decisions.
site_details: Call for assistance.
